result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Martin, Jerry O
defendant.address: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188

records.addlTxt:
9:31 AM Defendant Jerry O Martin in court, in custody.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Jerry O Martin.  Attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gutierrez requests a status date in 2-3 weeks.
State has no objection.
Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:03 AM Defendant Jerry O Martin in court, in custody.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Jerry O Martin.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defense requests a preliminary hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Officer Steven Pipia of the City of Waukesha Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Pitzo.
Cross examination by attorney Gutierrez.  
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State presents closing arguments and moves for bind over.
The Defense presents closing arguments and objects to bind over.
Response argument by the State.  
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on October 3, 2022 at 09:15 am.

1:51 PM Defendant Jerry O Martin in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense by Patrick Sicula. 
Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS. Bail remains as fixed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:15 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on September 16, 2022

ADDRESS INFO for Jerry O Martin
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 09-16-2022)
Prior: 5511 W. Keefe Ave., Milwaukee, WI 53218 United States

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

1:50 PM Defendant Jerry O Martin in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant was not evaluated by the public defender's office, as he refused.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
